Reviews.Title: Is no stars an option?
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I am figuring out that almost all of these nanny cams have similar problems - impossible or no instructions whatsoever. Granted, if you are electronics savvy you might be able to make heads or tails of this thing, but I couldn't. The software wouldn't install, I couldn't get it to record, and even though it claims to be up to 32 GB, it only fits a 4 GB card. I thought if we went for the more expensive item we would get quality and ease of use but no such luck. Don't even bother.

Reviews.Title: Great Design, Good Quality
Reviews.Author: KF8107
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the other reviewers statements I found this product to be good quality with a great design. Many of the smoke detectors I looked at had to be plugged into the wall. That didn't seem like a good design so I went with the Xtreme Life Smoke Detector because it is battery operated. The instructions made sense and the video quality was right on the money. I also am a big fan of the night vision capabilities, actually help me capture video at night when my teenager was sneaking back into the house past curfew. The Smoke Detector comes with a 4GB SD card to start you out, cables to charge the battery and connect to my TV, and a convenient SD Card Reader that allowed me to transfer to video easily on to my PC. I upgraded to a 32GB Card(max size for this product) and received 50 of video when the card was full. Couldn't ask for more, product worked as advertised and better than I expected.
